intro: Lomatogonium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Lomatogonium diffusum is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils and is drought-tolerant.
